==Friulian== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|fur|Vierte}} ===Etymology=== From the feminine of {{m|fur|viert}}, past participle of {{m|fur|vierzi||to open}}. Compare {{cog|vec|verta}}. ===Noun=== {{head|fur|noun|g=f}} # [[opening]] # [[spring]] (season) ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|spring}} {{l|fur|primevere}} [[Category:fur:Seasons]] ---- ==German== {{ordinalbox|de|3.|4.|5.|dritte|fünfte|card=vier}} ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|fiordo}} (akin to Old Saxon {{m|osx|fiortho}}), from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*fedurþô}}. Compare {{cog|nl|vierde}}, {{cog|da|fjerde}}, {{cog|en|fourth}}. ===Alternative forms=== * 4te (inflected forms: 4tem, 4ten, 4ter, 4tes) * 4. (also stands for inflected forms like ''vierter, viertes'') ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈfiːɐ̯tə/|/ˈfɪʁtə/}} * {{audio|de|De-vierte.ogg|audio}} ===Ordinal number=== {{head|de|numeral}} # {{cln|de|ordinal numbers}} [[fourth]] ====Declension==== {{rfc|de|It's "er ist Vierter" not "er ist vierter", compare findable "er wurde Vierter", "er war Vierter", "Leverkusen [...] ist Vierter in der Tabelle", "Mainz ist Vierter mit [...]". {{m|de|erste}} and ordinals after 4th might need the same cleanup as this entry...}} {{de-decl-adj-notcomp|viert|pred=viert|strong_pred=1}} ====Coordinate terms==== {{de-ordinals}} ====See also==== * {{l|de|Vierter}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Spanish== ===Verb=== {{head|es|verb form}} # {{es-verb form of|ending=er|mood=imperative|sense=affirmative|pers=2|formal=no|number=singular|verter}} # {{es-verb form of|ending=er|mood=indicative|tense=present|pers=2|formal=yes|number=singular|verter}} # {{es-verb form of|ending=er|mood=indicative|tense=present|pers=3|number=singular|verter}}
